questions.text: Which of the following correctly matches the historical figure to their key contribution?

Two countries implement contrasting national healthcare systems: Country X delivers free healthcare services entirely funded and administered by the central government through a bureaucratic apparatus. Country Y also provides healthcare and medical education at no cost, but the system is administered and regulated by independent professional medical bodies rather than direct government control. Which of the following best describes the models followed by Country X and Country Y, respectively?
questions.correct_answer: B. State Medicine and Socialized Medicine
questions.explanation: Ans. B) State Medicine and Socialized Medicine

questions.text: Which of the following achievements was not pioneered first by India?

options.label: A
options.text: Launch of a national family planning program

options.label: D
options.text: Launch of a national blindness control program

questions.correct_answer: B. Implementation of compulsory sickness insurance
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Implementation of compulsory sickness insurance

questions.text: Which of the following statements is not true regarding the public health institutes and their locations?

options.label: A
options.text: Haffkine Institute is located in Mumbai

options.label: B
options.text: Central Leprosy Training and Research Institute (CLTRI) is in Chengalpattu

options.label: C
options.text: National Institute of Epidemiology is based in Pune

options.label: D
options.text: National AIDS Control Organisation (NACO) is headquartered in New Delhi

questions.correct_answer: C. National Institute of Epidemiology is based in Pune
questions.explanation: Ans. C) National Institute of Epidemiology is based in Pune

questions.text: A medical student is interpreting a forest plot where the diamond-shaped pooled estimate barely touches the vertical line of no effect. What is the best interpretation regarding the significance and clinical relevance?

options.label: A
options.text: The result is statistically significant but clinically irrelevant

options.label: B
options.text: The result is statistically non-significant and should be discarded

options.label: C
options.text: The pooled effect is borderline and may be sensitive to methodological bias

options.label: D
options.text: The result is both clinically and statistically robust

questions.correct_answer: C. The pooled effect is borderline and may be sensitive to methodological bias
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The pooled effect is borderline and may be sensitive to methodological bias

questions.text: In a correlation study between serum cortisol and blood glucose, r = 0.62. The researchers then apply a regression model and find R² = 0.3844. What does this indicate?

options.label: A
options.text: 38.44% of variation in blood glucose is due to serum cortisol levels

options.label: B
options.text: 61.6% of variation in blood glucose is due to serum cortisol levels

questions.correct_answer: A. 38.44% of variation in blood glucose is due to serum cortisol levels
questions.explanation: Ans. A) 38.44% of variation in blood glucose is due to serum cortisol levels

questions.text: In which of the following scenarios would applying the Chi-square test be inappropriate due to the nature of the variable being analyzed?

options.label: A
options.text: Assessing association between treatment status and cure rate (yes/no)

options.label: B
options.text: Evaluating whether blood group distribution differs among tribal populations

options.label: C
options.text: Testing association between gender and diabetes prevalence

options.label: D
options.text: Comparing average hemoglobin levels between urban and rural residents

questions.correct_answer: D. Comparing average hemoglobin levels between urban and rural residents
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Comparing average hemoglobin levels between urban and rural residents

questions.text: In a comparison between two groups of hypertensive patients receiving two different salt-reduction counseling interventions, their systolic BP values (quantitative, non-parametric data) are compared after ranking. Which test should be used?
Identify the given statistical graph?
Which of the following best explains why standard error (SE) is considered a measure of "chance variation" and not an error?

options.label: B
options.text: SE is the standard deviation of sample means under repeated sampling

options.label: C
options.text: SE directly measures bias in data

options.label: D
options.text: SE is reduced by changing the population mean

questions.correct_answer: B. SE is the standard deviation of sample means under repeated sampling
questions.explanation: Ans. B) SE is the standard deviation of sample means under repeated sampling

questions.text: A 26-year-old male presents with fatigue and episodes of dark-colored urine. Laboratory evaluation reveals intravascular hemolysis. Flow cytometry is ordered to confirm paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH) using GPI-anchored proteins like CD55 and CD59. Which of the following plot combinations is most commonly used to display flow cytometric results for

A clinical laboratory reports serum TSH levels from a sample of 100 patients. The following summary statistics are noted: Mean = 3.1 mIU/L Median = 2.5 mIU/L Mode = 1.8 mIU/L Which of the following best describes the skewness of the distribution?

In a field nutrition survey of 8 under-five children, the mean weight was recorded as 12.6 kg. Two errors were later found: One child’s weight was recorded as 8 kg instead of 14 kg Another’s was 16 kg, but actually it was 12 kg What is the corrected mean?
The food item shown in the figure is the richest source of?

An intern at WHO is analyzing the organization's operational structure. Out of the below mentioned bodies which unit functions as the chief decision-making body with powers equivalent to a global “Health Parliament.” Which structure is she referring to?
Which of the following images best represents the World Health Day 2025 theme released by the WHO

A biodefense algorithm is designed to flag agents based on the following triad: No current vaccine Airborne transmissibility Natural reservoir in rodents Which of the following would most likely trigger this algorithm?
Identify the incorrect match among the following Nobel Laureates and their awarded contributions:
Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: B
options.text: Jungalwalla Committee allowed dual private practice for government doctors

options.label: C
options.text: Kartar Singh Committee created the concept of lady health visitors

options.label: D
options.text: Shrivastava Committee proposed referral service complexes between PHC and higher centers

questions.correct_answer: D. Shrivastava Committee proposed referral service complexes between PHC and higher centers
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Shrivastava Committee proposed referral service complexes between PHC and higher centers

questions.text: Which of the following does not belong to the "Health Care Characteristics" group?
Assertion (A): Sub-centres are entirely financed by the state governments. Reason (R): They form the most peripheral unit under the primary health care system.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is false, but R is true

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are false

questions.correct_answer: C. A is false, but R is true
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A is false, but R is true

questions.text: During a planning exercise under the National Health Mission, a district with mixed geography is being assessed for Primary Health Centre (PHC) allocation. According to IPHS 2022 guidelines, which of the following scenarios reflects a correct population-based deployment norm?

options.label: A
options.text: An urban PHC is planned for every 30,000 population in metropolitan slums

options.label: B
options.text: A rural PHC is sanctioned for every 50,000 population in a forest-dominated tribal belt

options.label: C
options.text: A rural PHC is proposed for every 30,000 population in plains region villages

options.label: D
options.text: A polyclinic is mandated for every 50,000–1,00,000 people in district headquarters

questions.correct_answer: C. A rural PHC is proposed for every 30,000 population in plains region villages
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A rural PHC is proposed for every 30,000 population in plains region villages

questions.text: A district health officer is revising the master plan for secondary care facilities. According to national guidelines, what is the standard bed strength that should be provisioned for a fully functional CHC?

During national health resource planning, a public health expert is assessing the disparity between international and domestic norms for ophthalmology services. Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding this?

options.label: A
options.text: India exceeds WHO standards by providing more ophthalmologists per capita

options.label: B
options.text: India matches WHO norms in terms of ophthalmologist density

options.label: C
options.text: India provides one ophthalmologist per 5 lakh population, which is below WHO standards

options.label: D
options.text: WHO recommends lower density of ophthalmologists than India for developing countries

questions.correct_answer: C. India provides one ophthalmologist per 5 lakh population, which is below WHO standards
questions.explanation: Ans. C) India provides one ophthalmologist per 5 lakh population, which is below WHO standards

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true regarding the responsibilities of Female Health Workers (FHW)? She conducts hemoglobin and urine testing during antenatal care. She distributes ORS for diarrheal diseases at household level. She maintains eligible couple registers and provides oral contraceptives. She assists in sputum collection and DOTS supervision.
Which of the following is not a stated function of NITI Aayog as per its founding framework?

options.label: A
options.text: Promotion of rapid rise in standard of living through resource utilization

options.label: B
options.text: Assessment of national resources and formulating effective plans

options.label: C
options.text: Administering direct financial aid to state-level programs

options.label: D
options.text: Determining national development priorities across sectors

questions.correct_answer: C. Administering direct financial aid to state-level programs
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Administering direct financial aid to state-level programs

questions.text: An analyst uses QALYs and DALYs to compare dialysis and transplant outcomes. However, they refuse to express these outcomes in monetary terms. Which analysis type is definitely not being used?

A flowchart is used in a health worker training session to show steps of neonatal resuscitation, without verbal explanation. One trainee says this helped her recall steps better than oral lectures. Which communication advantage is most clearly demonstrated here?

A ministry of health wants to forecast future antibiotic resistance patterns and gathers a panel of international infectious disease experts who never meet in person but participate through structured questionnaires. After several rounds, the responses begin to stabilize around a common set of forecasts. Which method is being used?
Match the Format to Its Feature

Match the following health education approaches with respective characteristics: Column A Regulatory approach Service approach Health education approach Primary healthcare approach Column B a. Rapid but coercive b. Enduring and behavior-modifying c. Doorstep delivery, low customization d. Emphasizes community self-reliance
A regional anti-smoking campaign provides only graphic images of lung damage and emotional testimonials from victims. Which of the following best classifies the nature of this strategy?

A public health team is evaluating the effectiveness of mass media campaigns in promoting smoking cessation. They note that despite widespread exposure via TV and radio, behavior change in target populations has been minimal. Which of the following are the most plausible limitations contributing to this outcome? Lack of audience feedback Inability to reach large audiences Requires high production costs in all settings Minimal influence on entrenched behaviors when used alone Limited impact among highly literate urban populations

An NGO-run health facility lacks access to incineration or autoclave technologies and seeks permission for deep burial of BMW. Which of the following must be satisfied for approval as per national guidelines?

options.label: A
options.text: Pit must be at least 1 meter deep and covered with sand and charcoal

options.label: B
options.text: Pit must be lined with lime, with lime-to-waste ratio 1:2

options.label: C
options.text: Pit/trench must be >2 meters deep and filled halfway before lime layering

options.label: D
options.text: Pit must be aerated and vented to avoid gas accumulation

questions.correct_answer: C. Pit/trench must be >2 meters deep and filled halfway before lime layering
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Pit/trench must be >2 meters deep and filled halfway before lime layering

questions.text: A group of volunteers is responding to a drought-affected area. Which of the following is considered a mitigation strategy rather than a relief or response measure?

options.label: A
options.text: Construction of elevated health posts with water purification systems

options.label: D
options.text: Sending vitamin A and zinc supplements

questions.correct_answer: A. Construction of elevated health posts with water purification systems
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Construction of elevated health posts with water purification systems

questions.text: A 28-year-old soldier sustains blast injuries in a conflict zone. He is unconscious with severe head trauma and multiple long bone fractures. Due to limited surgical staff and an urgent need to return more soldiers to combat, resources are diverted to less critical cases. What triage principle justifies this approach?
Least common Vitamin deficiency in post-disaster situation is?

A group of industrial workers are being evaluated for dust-related lung diseases. Which of the following statements about non-fibrogenic pneumoconioses are true? Siderosis from iron dust is usually non-progressive and benign. Stannosis occurs due to tin dust and is rarely clinically significant. Anthracosis leads to extensive fibrosis and respiratory failure in all patients. Silicosis is a non-fibrogenic pneumoconiosis.
Which of the following statements is true regarding sickness absenteeism in industrial settings in India?

options.label: A
options.text: It is caused solely by physical illnesses

options.label: B
options.text: Average annual absenteeism is 15–20 days per worker

options.label: C
options.text: It serves as an index of workers’ overall well-being

options.label: D
options.text: It is not affected by psychosocial stressors

questions.correct_answer: C. It serves as an index of workers’ overall well-being
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It serves as an index of workers’ overall well-being

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman working in a textile factory experiences persistent wheezing. Her history reveals chronic cotton dust exposure. According to the Factories Act, which clause mandates notification of her condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Section 89 of the Indian Penal Code

questions.text: According to the Mental Health Care Act, 2017, which of the following conditions qualifies as "mental illness" under its legal definition?

options.label: A
options.text: Alcohol abuse disorder with associated hallucinations

options.label: B
options.text: Mild intellectual disability with poor scholastic performance

options.label: C
options.text: Inability to read and write due to socioeconomic deprivation

options.label: D
options.text: High-functioning autism without mood or perceptual disturbances

questions.correct_answer: A. Alcohol abuse disorder with associated hallucinations
questions.explanation: Ans.  A) Alcohol abuse disorder with associated hallucinations

questions.text: A public health officer is testing the chlorine demand of a community water supply using Horrock’s Apparatus. After adding starch iodide indicator to each of the cups and allowing a reaction period, the third cup is the first to show a distinct blue coloration. Based on this observation, what is the appropriate dose of bleaching powder required to disinfect 455 liters of water?

A 10-year-old student collapses during morning assembly in a crowded school auditorium. The medical officer investigating the case suspects poor ventilation as a contributing factor. Environmental assessment of the space is initiated. What is the minimum recommended air change rate per hour in such a setting according to ventilation standards?
An occupational health physician assesses a textile mill for combined environmental heat exposure (temperature, humidity, radiant heat). Which of the following instruments is most appropriate?

A 32-year-old laboratory technician is asked to assess a raw sewage sample collected from the influent of a municipal wastewater treatment plant. The sample shows a Biological Oxygen Demand (BOD) of 320 g/L and suspended solids around 600 mg/L. Based on standard classification criteria, how should this sewage sample best be categorized?

A public health inspector evaluates a municipal swimming pool and finds that the pH of the pool water is 8.3. The chlorine residual is within the recommended range, but users have complained of eye irritation and reduced effectiveness of disinfection. Which of the following is the most appropriate corrective action?

options.label: A
options.text: Close the pool and initiate disinfection

options.label: B
options.text: Increase chlorination to compensate for pH

options.label: C
options.text: Adjust the pool water pH to bring it within 7.4–7.8

questions.correct_answer: C. Adjust the pool water pH to bring it within 7.4–7.8
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Adjust the pool water pH to bring it within 7.4–7.8

questions.text: A 45-year-old farmer from Bihar presents with chronic fever, weight loss, and hepatosplenomegaly. He is diagnosed with Kala-azar (Visceral Leishmaniasis). Which of the following is the most likely vector responsible for his condition?

A rural health surveillance team reports increasing cases of lymphatic filariasis with nocturnal periodicity of microfilariae. Which of the following public health interventions is most suitable to effectively target this vector?

options.label: A
options.text: The species is likely Aedes with cigar-shaped eggs

options.label: B
options.text: The adult is responsible for transmitting Japanese encephalitis

options.label: C
options.text: Control requires vegetation management rather than water source elimination

options.label: D
options.text: Vector control relies on spraying stagnant domestic water containers

questions.correct_answer: C. Control requires vegetation management rather than water source elimination

questions.text: The image below depicts the life cycle of a protozoan organism. Which of the following diseases is most likely caused by this organism?

A public health officer is investigating a recent surge in diarrheal illness in an urban slum. Environmental inspection reveals abundant presence of non-biting flies around exposed organic waste and open latrines. The vector observed is known to cause mechanical transmission of pathogens via surface contamination and regurgitation. Which of the following statements about this vector is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: It transmits disease via mechanical means such as defecation and vomit-drop.

options.label: B
options.text: It has a single nymphal stage and short pupal development.

options.label: C
options.text: It feeds only on liquefied food by first vomiting digestive enzymes.

options.label: D
options.text: It can travel distances up to 4 miles from its original breeding site.

questions.correct_answer: B. It has a single nymphal stage and short pupal development.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It has a single nymphal stage and short pupal development.

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Xenopsylla cheopis are true? It is a known biological vector of Chiggerosis and tapeworm infections. It transmits murine typhus and plague. It acts as a host for Hymenolepis nana and Hymenolepis diminuta. Control relies on aerial insecticide spraying in open rural fields.

A vector-control program in a rural agricultural region is implementing space spraying to control adult mosquitoes. The insecticide being used is a plant-derived compound extracted from chrysanthemum flowers and known for its knock-down effect due to neurotoxicity. However, one of the compounds listed below is not among the naturally occurring active principles of this insecticide. Which of the following is not an active component of this natural insecticide?

Case A: A public health program applies a green larvicide in stagnant ponds that is highly effective against Anopheles larvae and safe for fish and humans at recommended doses. Case B: Another program uses a compound that kills insects via acetylcholinesterase inhibition, has no repellent action, and acts slowly with effects lasting 18 months. Which of the following correctly matches the agents used in Case A and Case B respectively?
Which of the following statements regarding scabies is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Scabies can be classified as an STD due to skin-to-skin transmission

options.label: B
options.text: Tetmosol solution is typically applied once weekly for 3 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: Scabies is caused by Sarcoptes scabiei var. hominis

options.label: D
options.text: Premethrin is the drug of choice for topical management

questions.correct_answer: B. Tetmosol solution is typically applied once weekly for 3 weeks
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Tetmosol solution is typically applied once weekly for 3 weeks

questions.text: Which of the following parameters are used in the calculation of the Langlier Saturation Index (LSI)? Temperature of water Total dissolved solids (TDS) Turbidity Calcium hardness Alkalinity
A larval mosquito specimen is observed under a microscope. Based on the morphological characteristics shown in the image, which of the following mosquito species is this larva least likely to be?
Match each theory with its conceptualization of disease:
Match the following Psychological Concept with the respective Characteristics:
Which of the following individuals is least likely to be diagnosed with moderate mental retardation based on IQ levels?

options.label: A
options.text: A 12-year-old with a mental age of 4 years

options.label: C
options.text: A 9-year-old with a mental age of 6 years

options.label: D
options.text: A 10-year-old with a mental age of 4 years

questions.correct_answer: C. A 9-year-old with a mental age of 6 years
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A 9-year-old with a mental age of 6 years

questions.text: Which of the following statements most accurately captures the key distinction between social insurance and social assistance as applied in public health policy?

options.label: A
options.text: Social insurance is based on means-testing, whereas social assistance is contribution-based

options.label: B
options.text: Social insurance is non-contributory for vulnerable groups, while social assistance is employer-funded

options.label: C
options.text: Social insurance provides contributory, entitlement-based benefits; social assistance delivers need-based support without contribution

options.label: D
options.text: Social insurance guarantees universal access; social assistance requires employment-linked eligibility

questions.correct_answer: C. Social insurance provides contributory, entitlement-based benefits; social assistance delivers need-based support without contribution
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Social insurance provides contributory, entitlement-based benefits; social assistance delivers need-based support without contribution

questions.text: Which of the following pairings is incorrect regarding social group structure?

options.label: A
options.text: Crowd – Lacks leadership and internal organization

options.label: B
options.text: Mob – More stable than a crowd and less emotionally reactive

options.label: C
options.text: Herd – Follows a leader without question

options.label: D
options.text: Band – Smallest self-organized units with shared lifestyle

questions.correct_answer: B. Mob – More stable than a crowd and less emotionally reactive
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Mob – More stable than a crowd and less emotionally reactive

questions.text: A nutritionist is reviewing dietary plans for women in different physiological states based on the 2021 Indian nutritional guidelines. Which of the following combinations of additional energy and protein requirements is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Sedentary adult female: 1700 kcal/day and 45.7 g/day of protein

options.label: B
options.text: Heavy working adult male: 3500 kcal/day and 54 g/day of protein

options.label: C
options.text: Lactating woman (0–6 months): +600 kcal/day and +9.5 g/day of protein

options.label: D
options.text: Pregnant woman (third trimester): +350 kcal/day and +9.5 g/day +22 g/day of protein

questions.correct_answer: C. Lactating woman (0–6 months): +600 kcal/day and +9.5 g/day of protein
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Lactating woman (0–6 months): +600 kcal/day and +9.5 g/day of protein

questions.text: A pediatric nutritionist observes that children consuming only maize porridge are showing signs of stunted growth. Which of the following food pairings would best complement maize’s amino acid deficiency and improve overall protein quality?
questions.correct_answer: A. Adding soy milk to maize
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Adding soy milk to maize

questions.text: A nutritional scientist is assessing vitamin E requirements in two different populations. Group A consumes 40 g/day of essential fatty acids (EFA), while Group B consumes only 10 g/day. According to the standard guideline, what is the recommended difference in vitamin E requirement between the two groups?

A rural health officer wants to implement defluoridation measures in a community where fluorosis is prevalent. Which of the following fluoride levels most strongly mandates urgent implementation of the Nalgonda technique?

A milk sample from a processing unit shows absence of phosphatase enzyme, meets the bacterial count standard, but reveals 2 coliforms per mL. What conclusion can be drawn regarding the safety of this pasteurized milk?

options.label: A
options.text: It is adequately pasteurized and safe for consumption

options.label: B
options.text: It passes all pasteurization tests and meets WHO safety standards

options.label: C
options.text: It fails coliform count and should not be deemed safe

options.label: D
options.text: It shows inadequate phosphatase inactivation, making it unsafe

questions.correct_answer: C. It fails coliform count and should not be deemed safe
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It fails coliform count and should not be deemed safe

questions.text: According to the National Programme of Nutritional Support to Primary Education, which of the following correctly compares the daily recommended caloric and protein content provided to children in primary and upper primary classes?

options.label: A
options.text: Primary: 450 kcal, 12 g protein; Upper Primary: 650 kcal, 18 g protein

options.label: B
options.text: Primary: 400 kcal, 14 g protein; Upper Primary: 700 kcal, 20 g protein

options.label: C
options.text: Primary: 450 kcal, 12 g protein; Upper Primary: 700 kcal, 20 g protein

options.label: D
options.text: Primary: 500 kcal, 10 g protein; Upper Primary: 750 kcal, 22 g protein

questions.correct_answer: C. Primary: 450 kcal, 12 g protein; Upper Primary: 700 kcal, 20 g protein
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Primary: 450 kcal, 12 g protein; Upper Primary: 700 kcal, 20 g protein

questions.text: A public health team is conducting a nutritional assessment survey among children aged 6 to 59 months in a rural region with high rates of malnutrition. They aim to identify children with protein-energy malnutrition using field-friendly and WHO-recommended anthropometric tools. Which of the following combinations of indicators would be MOST appropriate for accurate identification of acute malnutrition in this age group?
questions.correct_answer: B. Weight-for-height and mid-upper arm circumference (MUAC)

questions.text: In a community, 10,000 live births were recorded in a year. There were 270 neonatal deaths and 400 infant deaths overall. What is the difference between the IMR and NNMR?
A region recorded the following for a year: Live births: 16,000 Stillbirths (>28 weeks): 300 Deaths of neonates within 7 days: 250 Calculate the Perinatal Mortality Rate (PMR).
A developing nation reports U5MR of 35 and CDR (1–4 year mortality rate) of 5. What is the estimated Infant Mortality Rate (IMR) in that country?

During a pediatric nutrition workshop, a resident is asked to identify which combination of features makes human milk superior in terms of developmental benefits for the infant brain. Which of the following combinations most accurately reflects these advantages?

options.label: A
options.text: Higher protein, more linoleic acid, better calcium absorption

options.label: B
options.text: More taurine and cystine, higher lactose, richer PUFA profile

options.label: C
options.text: Less lactose, more iron, higher calcium/phosphorus ratio

options.label: D
options.text: Lower fat content, more vitamin D, higher casein content

questions.correct_answer: B. More taurine and cystine, higher lactose, richer PUFA profile
questions.explanation: Ans. B) More taurine and cystine, higher lactose, richer PUFA profile

questions.text: A 6-month-old infant is evaluated for faltering growth. The mother reports exclusively breastfeeding and wonders if the milk output is sufficient. Based on WHO data for India, which of the following is the closest estimated volume of breast milk produced daily at this stage?

An epidemiological officer is analyzing data from a school health program in rural India to identify priority morbidities and screening strategies. Based on standard trends and national recommendations, which of the following statements are accurate? Goiter is the most commonly reported morbidity in Indian school children. Dental defects are more prevalent than malnutrition. The NRHM recommends medical examination of school children once a year. School eye screening programs primarily target students in middle school (ages 10–14 years).

A 32-year-old public health officer has been assigned to supervise an Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS) project in a tribal block with a total population of 35,000. According to national ICDS administrative norms, each project should be managed by a Community Development Project Officer (CDPO) and provide coverage through an appropriate number of Anganwadi Centres (AWCs). Based on the standard ICDS structure for tribal areas, what is the expected staffing and service distribution in this scenario?
